description:
Job ID**2407**
Work Type**Hybrid**
Business unit**Advisory Services**
Pay grade**H \- OTH**
Apply before**24 January 2026**
Number of openings**1**
Posting type**Internal \& External**
At ATB, we exist to make it possible for our clients, team members and communities. Our purpose is more than aspirational. It's a real commitment we live every day through our values (what we call the ATB ID).


Life at ATB is about more than work. In fact, we’re consistently recognized as one of Canada's top employers thanks to our high\-care, high\-performance culture, upheld by the three commitments we make to our team members:

**Impact in action:** No matter where you are in the organization, you're empowered to make an impact in the lives of our clients and communities.

**Thrive together:** We want you—the unique, authentic you—to feel safe and celebrated at work. We're on a continuous journey to build the most flexible and inclusive programs.

**Ready for tomorrow:** We want to enable your success through interesting and challenging work, performance enablement, and learning and development.


About the role

As ATB Wealth’s next Wealth Experience Associate, you are passionate about assisting Financial Advisors in managing and administering an assigned portfolio of ATB Wealth clients. Under the direction of the Manager, you are client obsessed and will be responsible for ensuring ongoing delivery of friendly, efficient and professional post sale service and support to a portfolio of ATB Wealth clients. You also seek out new information, share your ideas with the internal administrative support to your team. You bring your best self to work everyday as your other responsibilities include delivery of client investment needs, preparation and scheduling of annual and prospective client meetings and building strong internal relationships to maintain high levels of service.


This is a hybrid role based out of Sherwood Park and North Edmonton.


Accountabilities

The Wealth Experience Associate (WEA) acts as the administration manager, ensuring proactive administrative support services to the Financial Advisors in the delivery of client investment needs. They maintain a high level of quality service by ensuring the efficient preparation and fulfillment of all client account and transactional information requests and provide follow up service in a timely manner. They contribute to the achievement of business growth targets by proactively contacting clients or partners to arrange meetings and identifying new or additional sales opportunities to the Financial Advisor. They work with the Financial Advisors to ensure a triple win outcome as follows:

* Acts as the first point of contact for clients and strives to execute client requests with minimal to no Financial Advisor involvement, as appropriate. Determines which requests require investment advice and communicates these effectively to the Financial Advisor.
* Responds to client questions or concerns regarding investment products, processing procedures, fees and charges, and settlement expectations.
* Contacts and meets with clients to coordinate the sign off of investment documents, opens additional accounts, and answers any questions raised.
* Organizes and attends client hosting events by planning all event management activities to ensure a successful and value\-add affair.
* Maintains a strong understanding of investment related regulations, sales processes, policies \& procedures, and compliance requirements.
* Maintains a high level of quality service by ensuring the efficient preparation and fulfillment of all client account and transactional information requests and provides follow up service in a timely manner.
* Manages Financial Advisor’s client bookings through proactive scheduling of annual reviews and prospect meetings and advance preparation of materials for scheduled meetings.
* Monitors upcoming investment maturities through a diary system and pro\-actively initiates renewal steps with clients.
* Follows best practices in maintaining up to date client information and record keeping. Ensures post\-meeting notes and future action plans are updated and captured within Salesforce.
* Ensures all trading activities are processed in accordance with client requests and resolves any issues raised.
* The ideal candidate will be CIRO Registered as an Investment Representative, have experience supporting a wealth professional and a superstar with G\-suite tools and other wealth management systems.

Skills, experience \& requirements
* The ability to (or working towards) CIRO Registered as an Investment Representative
* Good working knowledge of wealth management solutions, sales processes, policies, and proceduresDemonstrated ability to deliver exceptional customer service and communicate effectively
* Exceptional administrative, organizational, and detail\-oriented skills
* Adept at cultivating professional connections through both digital and traditional channels
* Proven experience in prospecting and networking in previous roles is an asset
* Ability to oversee all administrative aspects of client investment accounts
* Strong working knowledge of G\-suite and computer skills
* Some post secondary education preferred or previous industry related experience would be an asset
**Don’t meet all the requirements on the list?**  

A resume only goes so far in expressing who you are and the unique perspectives you bring. If you believe your skills and experience align with the role—but you might not check all the boxes—we want to hear from you. We encourage candidates from all work backgrounds, equity\-seeking communities and experience levels to apply. If you’re seeking a career where your drive, perspective and growth are celebrated, we want to hear from you.


We’re dedicated to building a workforce reflective of those within our communities, and a culture where our team members are equipped with what they need to succeed—their way. Part of creating an inclusive workplace is recognizing our role in advancing Truth and Reconciliation. We are committed to meeting and exceeding the standards set out in the Partnership Accreditation in Indigenous Relations program created by the Canadian Council for Aboriginal Business.

**What happens next?**  

If you are shortlisted, you’ll hear from us after the posting closes. Check out our How We Hire page to learn more about our hiring process. If you need any accommodations throughout this process, please let us know at talentteam@atb.com

**Stay in touch**  

We’re excited that you’re interested in a career with ATB. Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to learn more about what our team is up to.
title: Wealth Experience Associate

**Ready for tomorrow:** We want to enable your success through interesting and challenging work, performance enablement, and learning and development.


About the Role

As ATB’s next **Third Party Relationships Analyst**, you will serve in a unique role that combines data analysis with AI\-driven process improvement for our Third Party Relationships team. You will turn data into actionable insights and leverage tools like Google Gemini to identify and implement efficiencies, streamline processes, and improve quality across the third party lifecycle (Sourcing, Contracting, Risk, and Performance). Your skills in data analysis, process design and improvement will build the foundation for a quality assurance function, designing reporting and tools that validate compliance with controls across the lifecycle.


Accountabilities
* Synthesize moderately complex data into actionable insights for strategic and business decisions across the entire third\-party lifecycle (Sourcing, Contracting, Risk, and Performance) using analytics, data visualizations, and dashboards
* Analyze datasets across the third\-party lifecycle to identify key trends and patterns, generating reports for leadership with a clear narrative, highlighting insights and conclusions that drive action with support from leadership
* Create, maintain, and update reports and dashboards showing metrics and outcomes derived from data analysis
* Assist with identifying and collaborating with stakeholders to resolve data discrepancies and ensure data completeness and accuracy
* Identify opportunities to integrate Generative AI (GenAI) into the Third Party Relationship team's processes to boost efficiency throughout the third\-party lifecycle
* Develop and refine AI prompts and outputs, ensuring reasonable reliability while determining where human\-in\-the\-loop review is essential
* Support learning sessions with the Third Party Relationship team to educate and roll out GenAI process improvements
* Assist with the development of a framework for quality assurance reporting and processes using data analysis to validate control compliance and data integrity across the third\-party lifecycle
* Support the Director and Senior Manager of Third Party Risk in the enhancement, execution and management of the Third Party Risk Management governance framework, associated processes, standards, and templates, ensuring alignment with industry practices and complementary enterprise functions
* Support other project work as required

Knowledge, Skills and Experience
* 1\-3 years of experience in a data analysis role
* Post\-secondary education (Bachelor’s degree or diploma) in business, data analytics, computer science or a related field
* Experience with visualization tools like Tableau or Data Studio
* Strong Google Sheets skills (Pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, Apps Script)
* Familiarity with Generative AI tools (Gemini, ChatGPT) and an interest in learning how to apply them to business operations
* Experience with the third\-party (vendor/supplier) lifecycle is an asset
* Working knowledge of the banking/financial services industry is an asset

Workplace Arrangement

This position has a hybrid work arrangement. On average, this means 1 day on\-site per week. Please note that this is subject to change due to business priorities.

A resume only goes so far in expressing who you are and the unique perspectives you bring. If you believe your skills and experience align with the role—but you might not check all the boxes—we want to hear from you. We encourage candidates from all work backgrounds, equity\-seeking communities and experience levels to apply. If you’re seeking a career where your drive, perspective and growth are celebrated, we want to hear from you.


We’re dedicated to building a workforce reflective of those within our communities, and a culture where our team members are equipped with what they need to succeed—their way. About the role

We are actively seeking a highly motivated, results\-oriented individual with experience in the financial services industry. This is a key role in the Fund Finance team that will lead the tax function for ATB Investment Management’s Investment Funds and play a critical role in the firm’s strategic direction.


We are looking for a team player that will bring not only exceptional technical skills and knowledge, but will also manage key relationships with both our internal stakeholders and external advisors. They will provide expert advice on tax matters that aligns with industry best practices, regulatory requirements and overall enterprise objectives

**Please note: This role is hybrid and can be based out of Calgary, Edmonton, or Toronto.**


Accountabilities
* Lead all tax compliance, tax reporting, Indirect Tax and PFIC reporting for the Investment Funds
* Oversee year\-end and ad\-hoc distribution process, liaise with fund administrator, external tax advisors, accounting and operations teams
* Ensure compliance with all foreign tax filings and withholding tax requirements on foreign investments. Optimize foreign tax credits with local and foreign services providers
* Review complex corporate actions and transactions for proper tax treatment
* Participate in strategic initiatives and projects including supporting future product development
* Oversee and manage relationships with external service providers and auditors, ensuring compliance and high work quality
* Research advanced tax issues, keep abreast of changes in tax and regulatory requirements
* Identify opportunities to improve and enhance data management, and automation related to tax reporting and compliance
* Assist with the implementation of tools and technology to enhance our investment management capabilities
* Apply proactive, creative thinking to identify and navigate emerging trends and share thought leadership
* Assist in establishing and maintaining proper policies and procedures

Skills, experience \& requirements
* CPA designation is required, enrolment or completion of the CPA Canada In\-Depth Tax Course is highly desirable
* Minimum of 5 years of progressive Canadian income tax experience, in a major accounting firm, asset manager or fund administrator.
* Understanding of Indirect Taxes as applicable to financial institutions and investment funds.
* Superior communication skills, both verbal and written, for dealing with the CRA, investors, and internal teams.
* Self\-starter with strong work ethic that takes initiative and ownership and seeks out clarification and guidance as needed
* Critical thinking and ability to solve complex problems and explain in general terms to various audiences
* Well organized with a strong attention to detail and high quality of work
* Ability to work under pressure and within tight deadlines

About the Role

Are you ready to champion the entrepreneurial spirit of Alberta? ATB is looking for an inspirational **Managing Director, Entrepreneurial Growth** to lead our charge in empowering entrepreneurs and small business owners. In this pivotal role, you will be the driving force behind achieving our Entrepreneurial Growth business goals by coaching and empowering a talented team of Senior Sales Leaders and Business Advisors in Calgary and Southern Alberta. You won't just manage; you'll shape the future of our client relationships, influence the team member experience, and ensure excellence in operations and risk management. If you thrive on challenging the status quo and leading through meaningful growth, this is your opportunity to directly impact the economic landscape of Alberta.


Accountabilities
* **Chart the Course:** Drive the vision, set ambitious goals, and prioritize strategic efforts to significantly grow and retain market share within the vital small business client segment.
* **Ignite Leadership:** Clarify expectations and elevate leadership capabilities across your teams, cultivating the skills and behaviours necessary for every team member to thrive, adapt, and perform at their best.
* **Build the Future:** Be a magnet for top talent \- attract, hire, and retain the right people in the right roles to fuel our growth.
* **Elevate Performance:** Provide insightful coaching, continuous feedback, and implement performance measures that inspire excellence and accountability.
* **Celebrate Success:** Create a culture of abundant recognition, celebrating results and successes with passion and authenticity.
* **Innovate the Experience:** Challenge current methods to deliver truly differentiating client and team experiences that advance the Entrepreneurial Growth Team's vision.
* **Be the Trusted Partner:** Ensure a consistent, high\-value client experience that continually deepens trust and confidence in ATB, with an unwavering focus on the needs of entrepreneurs.
* **Collaborate and Create Value:** Leverage your deep knowledge and expertise to forge powerful internal and external partnerships, creating exceptional value for our clients and stakeholders.
* **Lead Change:** Deliver strong business results and confidently drive necessary change within the organization.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience
* **Business Agility:** Possess the clear understanding of business drivers and levers, with the agility to adapt and utilize them effectively to pivot and strengthen your business plan.
* **Catalyst for Change:** A demonstrated ability to be a true catalyst \- inspiring new thinking, generating fresh momentum, and focusing action across a team of leaders.
* **Strategic Synthesizer:** A proven talent for cutting through complexity and 'noise' to identify key market trends and shifts that impact our business and our clients.
* **Proven Experience:** 10\+ years in business banking, sales and client relationship management, including at least 5 years of progressive leadership roles with a proven track record of leading teams through periods of change and significant growth.

Workplace Arrangement

This position has a hybrid work arrangement. On average, this means 3 days on\-site per week. Please note that this is subject to change due to business priorities.

About the Role

As ATB’s next EFS (Everyday Financial Services) **Business Advisor,** your role is to manage a portfolio of Mass Affluent Clients. You build, increase and retain valued business based on targets, financial acumen and joining the leadership team to provide specialized insights into the business. You excel at building your professional brand to create Centres of Influence (COI) that drive financial health throughout Everyday Financial Services (EFS) and the community. You manage complex retail and business deals and are able to translate information into easy\-to\-understand solutions for our clients.


Accountabilities
* You demonstrate a broad knowledge of finance, business management, and the local and global marketplace, including competitors and key players in the value chain, which allows you to provide relevant advice to our customers.
* You proactively take an informal leadership role by influencing and advising on established and new thinking, processes, and issues that support the advancement of the EFS Strategy.
* You provide the client with access to self service options, set them up on digital platforms whenever possible, and serve them through the channel of their choice.
* You translate annual business targets/metrics into actionable activities and routines.
* You are a trusted partner who can identify a business’ strengths and frame opportunities to determine the full partnership potential with ATB.
* You lead programs or initiatives that improve ATB's presence and reputation within the community, and take on leadership duties as required during the absence of formal leaders.
* You have a thorough understanding of Risk Management policies and procedures.
* You are consistently and confidently able to fulfill our customers' everyday banking needs through connecting them to the right products, services, and partners.
* You foster discussions and collaborative efforts around best practices while integrating them into the execution of your strategic plan and day to day routines.
* You hold to your commitments, and set clear priorities and realistic timeframes.

Skills, Experience \& Requirements

Your Attributes:

* You have exceptional customer service skills, with a demonstrated ability to establish and maintain professional relationships.
* You have in\-depth analytical and problem solving skills, as well as data\-driven decision making, with a customer\-oriented approach.
* You are a fluent communicator who can adapt communication style and methods to best suit your audience (verbal, written, \& digital).
* You have amazing attention to detail and follow\-through skills.
* You have expert knowledge of banking practices and regulations is a must have.


Accreditation:

* Post\-secondary degree/diploma in finance, business administration, or a related field.
* 5\+ years of relevant experience and/or certification in a related field of study desirable.
* 3\-5 years experience in retail and business banking.

About the Role **Elevate Your Career as a Personal Banking Advisor at ATB Financial!**


At ATB Financial, we’re more than just a bank; we’re a catalyst for financial well\-being and a partner in realizing Albertans’ aspirations. We’re seeking a dynamic **Personal Banking Advisor** to join our team and make a meaningful impact on the lives of our clients, especially those with higher net worth.

**Additional Information**

  

* This role requires Wednesday evening \& Saturday shifts on a rotating basis
* This role is based out of the Calgary McKenzie Towne branch, but on occasion may be required to travel to neighbouring branches.

Accountabilities  

As ATB’s next Personal Banking Advisor, you will:

* **Be a Trusted Financial Partner**: Offer customized guidance and solutions tailored to the specific financial situations of high\-net\-worth clients. Proactively interact with these clients to ascertain their financial objectives and risk appetite, and identify situations requiring escalation due to complexity.
* **Build Lasting Relationships**: Cultivate strong client relationships through consistent communication, follow\-ups, and proactive outreach. Expand your client base by attracting new clients, building a strong sales pipeline and deepening existing connections.
* **Drive Sales with Expertise**: Guide retail personal and business clients toward the right savings, investment, and lending products for their short\- and long\-term goals. This includes registered and non\-registered investments, credit cards, and complex credit/lending products like mortgages and HELOCs.
* **Connect and Collaborate**: Demonstrate critical thinking to address complex client needs, connecting with internal partners to leverage ATB’s full suite of services.
* **Champion Digital Innovation**: Be a subject matter expert in ATB’s digital and omnichannel adoption, promoting digital tools and educating clients on their use. Embrace new technologies to enhance efficiency and the client experience.
* **Be a Community Ambassador**: Demonstrate cultural sensitivity and self\-awareness, investing in community involvement and representing ATB in the market.
* **Act with Integrity**: Ensure data privacy and security, and optimize risk and compliance management by adhering to regulatory requirements.
* **Achieve Success**: Achieve personal sales targets and goals, building a strong sales pipeline to contribute to the success of the branch, market, and overall business

Skills, Experience \& Requirements **Who You Are**:


You forge meaningful connections with clients, personalize your understanding of their needs, and offer thoughtful guidance to build their financial confidence. You thrive in collaborative environments, embrace new technologies, and are committed to continuous learning. You possess strong sales skills and approach complex problems with curiosity and a focus on the client experience.

**What You Bring**:

* 3 \- 5 years of experience in identifying and converting a sales pipeline, delivering exceptional client experiences.
* Relevant experience in the retail banking industry or a similar field.
* Completion of CSI Personal Financial Services Advice (PFSA).
* A comprehensive understanding of a diverse range of lending products, including but not limited to: residential mortgages, various types of loans (i.e. personal), credit card offerings and lending solutions. This experience encompasses familiarity with product features, eligibility criteria, and the lifecycle of these financial instruments.
* Post\-secondary degree/diploma in finance, business administration, or relevant work experience.

 **Ready to reimagine possibilities and make a difference? Join ATB Financial and help our clients thrive!**

 **Don’t meet all the requirements on the list?**  

A resume only goes so far in expressing who you are and the unique perspectives you bring. If you believe your skills and experience align with the role—but you might not check all the boxes—we want to hear from you. We encourage candidates from all work backgrounds, equity\-seeking communities and experience levels to apply. If you’re seeking a career where your drive, perspective and growth are celebrated, we want to hear from you.

* **Connect and Collaborate**: Demonstrate critical thinking to address complex client needs, connecting with internal partners to leverage ATB’s full suite of services.
* **Champion Digital Innovation**: Be a subject matter expert in ATB’s digital and omnichannel adoption, promoting digital tools and educating clients on their use. Embrace new technologies to enhance efficiency and the client experience.
* **Be a Community Ambassador**: Demonstrate cultural sensitivity and self\-awareness, investing in community involvement and representing ATB in the market.
* **Act with Integrity**: Ensure data privacy and security, and optimize risk and compliance management by adhering to regulatory requirements.
* **Achieve Success**: Achieve personal sales targets and goals, building a strong sales pipeline to contribute to the success of the branch, market, and overall business

Skills, Experience \& Requirements **Who You Are**:


You forge meaningful connections with clients, personalize your understanding of their needs, and offer thoughtful guidance to build their financial confidence. You thrive in collaborative environments, embrace new technologies, and are committed to continuous learning. You possess strong sales skills and approach complex problems with curiosity and a focus on the client experience.

**What You Bring**:

* 3 \- 5 years of experience in identifying and converting a sales pipeline, delivering exceptional client experiences.
* Relevant experience in the retail banking industry or a similar field.
* Completion of CSI Personal Financial Services Advice (PFSA).
* A comprehensive understanding of a diverse range of lending products, including but not limited to: residential mortgages, various types of loans (i.e. personal), credit card offerings and lending solutions. This experience encompasses familiarity with product features, eligibility criteria, and the lifecycle of these financial instruments.
* Post\-secondary degree/diploma in finance, business administration, or relevant work experience.

 **Ready to reimagine possibilities and make a difference? Join ATB Financial and help our clients thrive!**

A resume only goes so far in expressing who you are and the unique perspectives you bring. About the role

This position has a **hybrid work arrangement.** On average, this means 1 day on\-site per week. Please note that this is subject to change due to business priorities.

**As ATB's next** **Senior Manager in Commercial Risk Advisory and Management (also known as "Special Loans")**, you will manage a portfolio of distressed borrowers with the potential to work on impaired accounts. The Senior Manager works collaboratively with Underwriting, Credit, and other internal and external partners to manage the client relationship. The role focuses on working with clients towards turnaround where possible, or to realize on assets and maximize recoveries when necessary, all while minimizing risk to ATB.

**At ATB, we invest in your expertise**. In this role, you'll gain:

* Special loans experience to gain deep insight into financial analysis and credit structuring.
* An intimate understanding of collateral, enforcement actions, and court processes.
* Independence and guided learning by directly managing a portfolio of distressed borrowers, offering a mix of autonomy and support from your leaders.

**Start building your future with ATB**. This position is designed to equip you with the essential skills and foundational knowledge that can open doors to numerous career advancements within our organization. Your journey could lead to roles in Sales Lending, Sales Leadership, Credit Adjudication, Corporate Special Loans, and more.


Accountabilities

Responsibilities include:

* Analyze borrower’s status quo, forecast, and business plan to assess underlying cause of financial difficulty, the business cycle, and future viability;
* Develop and execute credit restructuring plan or exit strategy in order to manage risk and minimize losses on non\-performing business loans;
* Underwrite submissions to Credit and ensure that recommendations are in accordance with sound credit granting principles and ATB’s lending policies and procedures;
* Structure and negotiate loan amendments or forbearance terms with the borrower;
* Review all security documents and agreements to ensure they are valid and enforceable;
* Provide day\-to\-day oversight and management of portfolio to ensure customer service expectations and credit quality is maintained and conduct portfolio health monitoring/maintenance;
* Work and communicate seamlessly with restructuring professionals, insolvency counsels, valuators, and financial advisors;
* Depending on skills and expertise, may be involved in collateral value estimations and associated loan loss provisions for impaired borrowers; and
* Establish and maintain strong relationships at every level across industries and internally across the organization.

Skills, experience \& requirements
* A post\-secondary degree in business with a **minimum of 3 years commercial lending experience, including portfolio management, deal structuring, and client negotiations,** with small and medium sized business loans in the diversified space;
* A related graduate level degree such as MBA, CPA, CFA or CIRP would be an asset;
* Detail oriented with strong attention to accuracy along with advanced credit structuring, underwriting, and financial analysis skills;
* Familiarity with business credit and security documents with a basic understanding of contract law as it pertains to security agreements;
* Experience in working with challenged accounts along with practical knowledge of collection procedures (e.g.,
* Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act, Civil Enforcement Act, Forbearance Agreement, Foreclosures, Receiverships, etc.) would be considered an asset;
* Strong negotiating and conversational skills to handle difficult conversations;
* Capable of making sound decisions in the absence of detailed instructions; and
* A Client Obsessed focus with a desire to be a Champion of Belonging.

You also seek out new information, share your ideas with the internal administrative support to your team. You bring your best self to work everyday as your other responsibilities include delivery of client investment needs, preparation and scheduling of annual and prospective client meetings and building strong internal relationships to maintain high levels of service.


Accountabilities

The Wealth Experience Associate (WEA) acts as the administration manager, ensuring proactive administrative support services to the Financial Advisors in the delivery of client investment needs. They maintain a high level of quality service by ensuring the efficient preparation and fulfillment of all client account and transactional information requests and provide follow up service in a timely manner. They contribute to the achievement of business growth targets by proactively contacting clients or partners to arrange meetings and identifying new or additional sales opportunities to the Financial Advisor. They work with the Financial Advisors to ensure a triple win outcome as follows:

* Acts as the first point of contact for clients and strives to execute client requests with minimal to no Financial Advisor involvement, as appropriate. Determines which requests require investment advice and communicates these effectively to the Financial Advisor.
* Responds to client questions or concerns regarding investment products, processing procedures, fees and charges, and settlement expectations.
* Contacts and meets with clients to coordinate the sign off of investment documents, opens additional accounts, and answers any questions raised.
* Organizes and attends client hosting events by planning all event management activities to ensure a successful and value\-add affair.
* Maintains a strong understanding of investment related regulations, sales processes, policies \& procedures, and compliance requirements.
* Maintains a high level of quality service by ensuring the efficient preparation and fulfillment of all client account and transactional information requests and provides follow up service in a timely manner.
* Manages Financial Advisor’s client bookings through proactive scheduling of annual reviews and prospect meetings and advance preparation of materials for scheduled meetings.
* Monitors upcoming investment maturities through a diary system and pro\-actively initiates renewal steps with clients.
* Follows best practices in maintaining up to date client information and record keeping. Ensures post\-meeting notes and future action plans are updated and captured within Salesforce.
* Ensures all trading activities are processed in accordance with client requests and resolves any issues raised.
* The ideal candidate will be CIRO Registered as an Investment Representative, have experience supporting a wealth professional and a superstar with G\-suite tools and other wealth management systems.

Skills, experience \& requirements
* The ability to (or working towards) CIRO Registered as an Investment Representative
* Good working knowledge of wealth management solutions, sales processes, policies, and proceduresDemonstrated ability to deliver exceptional customer service and communicate effectively
* Exceptional administrative, organizational, and detail\-oriented skills
* Adept at cultivating professional connections through both digital and traditional channels
* Proven experience in prospecting and networking in previous roles is an asset
* Ability to oversee all administrative aspects of client investment accounts
* Strong working knowledge of G\-suite and computer skills
* Some post secondary education preferred or previous industry related experience would be an asset

At ATB Financial, we’re more than just a bank; we’re a catalyst for financial well\-being and a partner in realizing Albertans’ aspirations. We’re seeking a dynamic **Personal Banking Advisor** to join our team and make a meaningful impact on the lives of our clients, especially those with higher net worth.

**Additional Information**

* This is a temporary 12 months opportunity
* This role requires Saturday shifts on a rotating basis
* This role is based out of the Lethbridge Mayor Magrath Dr branch, but on occasion may be required to travel to neighbouring branches.

Accountabilities  

As ATB’s next Personal Banking Advisor, you will:

* **Be a Trusted Financial Partner**: Offer customized guidance and solutions tailored to the specific financial situations of high\-net\-worth clients. Proactively interact with these clients to ascertain their financial objectives and risk appetite, and identify situations requiring escalation due to complexity.
* **Build Lasting Relationships**: Cultivate strong client relationships through consistent communication, follow\-ups, and proactive outreach. Expand your client base by attracting new clients, building a strong sales pipeline and deepening existing connections.
* **Drive Sales with Expertise**: Guide retail personal and business clients toward the right savings, investment, and lending products for their short\- and long\-term goals. This includes registered and non\-registered investments, credit cards, and complex credit/lending products like mortgages and HELOCs.
* **Connect and Collaborate**: Demonstrate critical thinking to address complex client needs, connecting with internal partners to leverage ATB’s full suite of services.
* **Champion Digital Innovation**: Be a subject matter expert in ATB’s digital and omnichannel adoption, promoting digital tools and educating clients on their use. Embrace new technologies to enhance efficiency and the client experience.
* **Be a Community Ambassador**: Demonstrate cultural sensitivity and self\-awareness, investing in community involvement and representing ATB in the market.
* **Act with Integrity**: Ensure data privacy and security, and optimize risk and compliance management by adhering to regulatory requirements.
* **Achieve Success**: Achieve personal sales targets and goals, building a strong sales pipeline to contribute to the success of the branch, market, and overall business

Skills, Experience \& Requirements **Who You Are**:


You forge meaningful connections with clients, personalize your understanding of their needs, and offer thoughtful guidance to build their financial confidence. You thrive in collaborative environments, embrace new technologies, and are committed to continuous learning. You possess strong sales skills and approach complex problems with curiosity and a focus on the client experience.

**What You Bring**:

* 3 \- 5 years of experience in identifying and converting a sales pipeline, delivering exceptional client experiences.
* Relevant experience in the retail banking industry or a similar field.
* Completion of CSI Personal Financial Services Advice (PFSA).
* A comprehensive understanding of a diverse range of lending products, including but not limited to: residential mortgages, various types of loans (i.e. personal), credit card offerings and lending solutions. This experience encompasses familiarity with product features, eligibility criteria, and the lifecycle of these financial instruments.
* Post\-secondary degree/diploma in finance, business administration, or relevant work experience.

About the role

As the next **Managing Director, ATB Investment Management Governance and Sr. Regulatory Counsel**, you will apply both your expertise and your experience working within, acting as outside counsel for, or regulating portfolio managers and/or investment fund managers to help the business manage key ongoing legal, regulatory and governance related initiatives. In this role, you will work hand in hand with senior leaders in the business, the CCO and compliance team, as well as ATB’s Legal Services group to offer strategic and practical legal and regulatory counsel on a broad spectrum of issues relevant to the growth and management of ATB Investment Management (ATBIM).


Additionally you will be responsible for managing interactions with external counsel, regulators, and governance bodies like ATBIM's Independent Review Committee (IRC).

  

Accountabilities

More specific, as a key member of the team, you will support the business by:

* Advising on the development, structuring and offering of investment funds (traditional, alternative and ETFs) and drafting / updating documentation relating to.
* Proactively interpreting legislation which impacts the business, and incorporating changes, practices and documentation.
* Researching legal and securities regulatory issues and developments, often of substantial complexity, and both informing and providing guidance to the business on the implications.
* Identifying and resolving legal and regulatory issues, risks and concerns, and providing recommended course of action.
* Drafting, reviewing and negotiating legal agreements, developing and filing (where required) various forms and disclosure documents for all elements of the business, including investment funds, portfolio management and investment counseling.
* Identifying and assessing legal risks and developing strategies to mitigate risk and protect ATBIM’s interests.
* Partnering with compliance and risk teams on development and review of key policies governing the business.
* Leading the engagement with and organization of the Independent Review Committee and its activities, and providing for the support that it requires in discharging its duties.
* Providing legal research, analysis and advice on business activities.
* Instructing and directing the activity of external counsel.
* Developing and maintaining strong working relationships with the Legal Services team and other key internal business units and partners.
* Undertake day\-to\-day activities in a manner consistent with ATB and ATBIM's risk culture and the relevant risk appetite statement and limits.
* Other duties in support of the broader ATB Wealth business as may be required from time to time.

Skills, experience \& requirements
* Ideally 7\+ years (minimum 5\) of experience in a relevant law firm, regulator and/or in\-house position practicing securities law, with experience advising on fund offerings and investment management activities.
* Experience providing legal support to asset management firms, pension funds or other buy side participants would be an asset.
* Graduated from a nationally recognized law school and have membership in good standing with your relevant law society
* You are a critical thinker with excellent judgment who also has strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work collaboratively and effectively with multiple partners and stakeholders.
* You have superior communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with senior members of ATB Investment Management, ATB Wealth, Legal Services and other areas of ATB Financial
* You can manage multiple deadlines and priorities without sacrificing focus and attention to detail and work independently to provide legal support on major projects in a fast\-paced environment.

As ATB Wealth’s next Financial Advisor, you will be working under the leadership of the Regional Director and will be responsible for the investment advice and holistic financial planning needs of existing and prospective clients. This is a sales\-driven, client\-focused role that blends advisory expertise with relationship management. This includes the development of robust external centers of influences coupled with a primary branch network to further enhance the customer experience at ATB. You will be working with a team of advisors and private investment counselors to deliver a customer obsessed wealth experience, drive strong relationships with partners. Within the branch, you will coach and influence advisors, foster a culture of collaboration, and contribute to an exceptional client experience that reflects ATB’s commitment to helping Albertans make their time richer, happiness deeper, and aspirations closer.


Accountabilities
* Deliver exceptional financial advice and planning by deeply understanding each client’s goals, priorities, and life stage — helping them build wealth, protect what matters, and achieve their dreams.
* Drive growth through sales and new client acquisition, actively prospecting and developing relationships with existing clients, referrals, and centers of influence within the community.
* Partner and collaborate across ATB, working closely with branch teams, business banking, and Senior Financial Advisors to connect clients with the right experts and solutions for a seamless One ATB experience.
* Champion client experience by providing trusted, personalized guidance that simplifies financial decisions and builds long\-term confidence and loyalty.
* Be a visible leader within your community, engaging in local events, sponsorships, and networking opportunities that strengthen ATB’s presence and commitment to helping Albertans thrive.
* Coach and mentor branch colleagues to elevate financial literacy, build referral confidence, and support a culture of teamwork and performance.
* Leverage technology and data insights to manage your pipeline, track progress, and deliver efficient, impactful client interactions.
* Leverage specialized experts to help provide trusted advice in a smart, simple and helpful way that is personalized to each and every client
* Deeply understand our clients and commit to always having their best interests at heart. You will work towards earning the trust of our clients, to not just advise clients but to challenge them to make the best financial decisions possible
* Strive to make our clients time richer, happiness deeper and aspirations closer as we ensure that they are supported throughout their journey
* Help them to connect the dots between their wealth and aspirations and support them at every stage of their lives

Skills, Experience \& Requirements
* 5 years of sales and customer experience in the financial services industry (preferably Wealth Management)
* Immediate CIRO registration through one of the following:  

	+ Currently a Registered Representative (RR) through CIRO,
	+ Completion of Canadian Securities Course, Conduct and Practices Handbook Course, and Wealth Management Essentials within the last 3 years OR
	+ **New CIRO requirements effective as of January 1, 2026:** Actively enrolled in or completed the Canadian Investment Regulatory Exam (CIRE) \& Retail Securities Exam (RSE)
* Undergraduate degree in Commerce, Economics, Business or a related field (equivalent combination of experience and education will be considered)
* Completed or working towards a financial planning designation would be considered an asset
* Effective relationship building, communication and discovery skills. This will help you to establish relationships with various centers of influences including branches, your advisors team and other teams across the organization
* The ability to meet or exceed required sales goals, by continuously driving to find opportunities to reach new customers
* Ability to embrace existing technology to maximize productivity, enhance processes and support our client experience
* Pursuing the QAFP and CFP designation is expected as part of this role

About the role

This position has a **hybrid work arrangement.** On average, this means **2\-4 days on\-site per quarter.** Please note that this is subject to change due to business priorities.

**As ATB’s next FinOps Lead,** you will be a highly visible and influential individual contributor role navigating the critical relationship between cloud providers and cloud consumers (Engineering). You won't just report numbers; you will help manage the performance and delivery of cloud services to ensure our technology teams keep pace and stay ahead of demand.


Your mission is to provide governance and oversight to operational capacity, managing risk while empowering engineers to innovate. You will move us beyond simple "cost reporting" to true Unit Economics and Value\-Based decision\-making.


Accountabilities
**Data Analysis \& Reporting (The Technical Core):**

* **Go Deep on Data**: You won't rely on pre\-canned reports. You will create complex SQL queries to transform raw cost/usage data into actionable insights.
* **Dashboarding:** Develop and maintain dashboards (Tableau, Looker, DataStudio) for consumption at various levels of the organization—from Executive Summaries to Engineer\-level views.
* Implement data model to provide better granularity and visibility into cloud financial forecasting

**Forecasting \& Migration Strategy:**

* **Predict with Confidence**: Create and oversee the process for migration forecasts and ongoing consumption models. You will monitor variances between budget and actuals, pushing for mitigating actions when they drift.
* **Agile Budgeting**: Leverage cloud agile processes to assess and rebalance spend on a weekly/monthly basis, minimizing the variance between what we planned and what we spent.

**Process \& Governance:**

* **Define the Standard**: Develop and implement policies and workflows to manage risk in our cloud infrastructure.
* **Automation**: Work with the DevOps/SRE team to define requirements for automating key Cloud Asset and financial metrics. (Scripting skills in Python/Shell are a huge asset here).

**Communication \& Influence:**

* **Bridge the Gap**: Establish a regular communication cadence across the organization to discuss strategic objectives, best practices, and KPIs.
* **Optimization**: Work directly with business units to evaluate optimization opportunities—whether that is a process improvement or a technology architecture change.

**Skills, Experience \& Requirements:**

* **Experience**: 3\+ years in a FinOps or Data Analyst role.
* **The "Bi\-Lingual" Skill Set**: You have the ability to translate between Finance (Budgets, Forecasts) and Engineering (Services, Architecture).

**Technical Chops:**

* Strong experience with **SQL** for querying complex datasets is required.
* Experience creating dashboards (Tableau, Looker, DataStudio, etc.).
* Automation tooling (Shell scripting, Cloud SDK, Python) is a strong asset.

**Problem Solving:** You are a proactive thinker who can recognize patterns in processes, discover conflicts, and influence others to adopt new workflows.

**Certifications**: Certifications from cloud providers (AWS/Azure) and/or FinOps (FOCP) are an asset.


Skills, experience \& requirements
* You have more than 3 years in FinOps or a Data Analyst role
* You have some experience with structured Query Language (SQL) for querying complex datasets
* You have experience creating dashboards (Tableau, Looker, DataStudio etc)
* Automation tooling (Shell scripting, Cloud SDK, Python) would be considered an asset
* You have good communication skills (both oral and written)
* You must be a proactive thinker
* You have demonstrated capacity for problem solving, synthesis and making clear recommendations with supporting arguments
* You are adept at recognizing patterns in current processes, discovering common approaches, conflicts and gaps where practicable
* You have a proven track record relating to process development and implementation, including the ability to influence others to follow and/or adopt those processes
* Certifications from cloud providers and / or FinOps would be an asset.

Reporting to the Associate Vice President of Portfolio Management the **Director Portfolio Management** will be responsible for leading a team of Associate Directors and Associates in ATB Business Banking Real Estate. The Director will be responsible for the general oversight and execution of the ATB Business Real Estate Credit Portfolio and will coordinate the development of procedures and processes with the focus of maintaining a high quality risk culture and delivering for our clients at ATB.

  

The Director, Portfolio Management will play an essential role as a leader in the hiring, development and training of ATB Associate Directors and Associates and will be expected to provide feedback and recommendations. Training and sharing of information amongst ATB teammates and other areas of the bank will be emphasized with promotion of best practices and coordination with other underwriting groups within ATB. With strong experience in the Real Estate industry and commercial lending, you will use this knowledge to ensure proper credit presentation and structuring of transactions. * Coordinate multiple activities and projects with the management of team members

* Responsible for the overall hiring, training and development of team members; assist current team members work towards their desired career goals

* Assist in identifying any weaknesses within the Portfolio Managed credit writing process and establish action plans to increase overall efficiencies and effectiveness.
* Stand\-up and lead projects related to addressing and improving credit underwriting
* Responsible to maintain appropriate oversight of the Associate Directors in respect to: credit underwriting, use of appropriate tools and resources, reporting and covenants and expiry management

* Stay current on best industry practices and be a subject matter expert for your team

* Prior leadership experience leading individual contributors considered an asset
* 5\+ years in a corporate banking / credit environment
* 3\+ years of customer relationship management
* Exposure to multiple lines of business and multiple industries

About the role  

ATB Capital Markets, a division of ATB Financial, is a fully integrated broker dealer providing a full suite of financial service solutions for the treasury, finance, capital markets and advisory needs of its corporate clients including:

* Corporate banking, loan syndications and project finance
* Debt capital, equity capital and financial markets
* Institutional sales and trading
* Expert advice on mergers and acquisitions, divestiture and private equity
* Institutional research to leverage industry and sector insight

**ATB Capital Markets** is looking for a **Summer Student** to support our **Research Team** and a key project involving industry database manipulation, analysis, and developing insights from data.  

  

As ATB’s next **Research Summer Student** you are curious, hungry and passionate about investment research. You are a team player, eager to learn and looking to grow in your career. You have an analytical mind, an aptitude to dive deep into a topic and a passion for the stock market.


Accountabilities* Create and maintain company financial models.
* Create exhibits suitable for supporting analysis and publishing.
* Maintenance of industry databases and company\-specific spreadsheets as well as the use of industry\-specific software.
* Assist in generating research publications including writing, editing, and final report preparation.
* Conduct primary research from industry and financial sources.
* Prepare and maintain marketing presentations as required.
* Liaise with sales, trading and other areas of the firm within regulatory guidelines.

Skills, experience \& requirements
* Pursuing a university degree focused on Finance, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or Geology.
* Must be willing and able to work onsite 100% at our office located at 8th Avenue Place in Calgary, AB.
* Passionate about investment research.
* Ability to conduct in\-depth fundamental investment research.
* Strong accounting, financial modeling, technical and writing skills.
* Experience working with market data sets and add\-ins including Bloomberg, Thomson, FactSet and Capital IQ a plus.
* Previous experience with geoScout is an asset.
* Must have extensive MS Excel experience.
* Excellent command of Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, etc.).
* Need to possess strong written and verbal communication skills in both technical and non\-technical forms.
* Ability to perform under pressure and meet tight deadlines, sometimes for extended periods.
* Ability to multitask and manage several on\-going projects at the same time with a client\-oriented focus.
* Self\-motivated, hardworking and detail\-oriented.
* Coding experience is an asset.

About the Role **Shape the Future as a Senior Personal Banking Advisor at ATB Financial!**


At ATB Financial, we’re not just about transactions; we’re about building lasting relationships and empowering clients to achieve their most ambitious financial goals. We’re looking for an experienced **Senior Personal Banking Advisor** to join our team and become a trusted partner for our valued clients, including high\-net\-worth individuals and small businesses.

**Additional Information**

* This role is based out of the Killarney branch, but on occasion may be required to travel to neighbouring branches.
  

Accountabilities  

As ATB’s next Senior Personal Banking Advisor, you will:

* **Be a Trusted Advisor**: Deepen client relationships by providing personalized financial planning and sophisticated solutions. You’ll be the go\-to expert for complex needs, including estate planning and intricate mortgages.
* **Elevate the Client Experience**: Uphold our Experience Standards with unwavering commitment. Offer tailored advice that goes beyond the ordinary, addressing the unique circumstances of each client.
* **Connect and Collaborate**: Demonstrate critical thinking to solve complex problems. Partner with internal teams (Wealth, Business) to provide holistic solutions for clients with multifaceted needs.
* **Nurture Relationships**: Build and maintain strong connections through regular communication and follow\-ups. Develop and implement relationship management plans for high\-value clients.
* **Drive Growth**: Achieve personal sales targets by cultivating a robust sales pipeline and expanding your book of business. Actively build and leverage an external network to generate new opportunities.
* **Champion Digital Fluency**: Embrace new technologies and serve as a digital and omnichannel champion. Educate clients on digital tools and promote their adoption.
* **Act with Integrity**: Optimize risk and compliance management, ensuring data privacy and security. Make confident, financially sound decisions that prioritize customer satisfaction and align with ATB’s risk culture.
* **Embrace Diversity and Community**: Demonstrate cultural sensitivity and self\-awareness, considering the varied needs and backgrounds of our clients. You’ll also invest in community involvement and represent ATB in the market.
* **Mentor and Lead**: Continuously develop your technical skills and embody ATB’s leadership attributes. Share your expertise to build acumen within the team and assume leadership responsibilities as needed.

Skills, Experience \& Requirements **Who You Are**:


You are an experienced financial professional with a proven track record of building and growing a book of business. You possess deep knowledge of financial planning, estate planning, and complex mortgage products. You’re a natural connector, a lifelong learner, and passionate about delivering exceptional client experiences.

**What You Bring**:

* 4 \- 6 years of experience in retail banking or a similar industry.
* Proven track record of maintaining and growing a book of business.
* Strong knowledge of financial planning, estate planning, and complex mortgage products.
* PFSA, FP1 Accreditation is required.
* Post\-secondary degree/diploma in finance, business administration, or a related field or relevant work experience.

 **Ready to make a significant impact and shape the future of financial well\-being? Join ATB Financial as a Senior Personal Banking Advisor and help our clients thrive!**

You forge meaningful connections with clients, personalize your understanding of their needs, and offer thoughtful guidance to build their financial confidence. About the Role

As ATB’s next EFS (Everyday Financial Services) **Business Advisor,** your role is to manage a portfolio of Mass Affluent Clients. You build, increase and retain valued business based on targets, financial acumen and joining the leadership team to provide specialized insights into the business. You excel at building your professional brand to create Centres of Influence (COI) that drive financial health throughout Everyday Financial Services (EFS) and the community. You manage complex retail \& business deals and are able to translate information into easy\-to\-understand solutions for our clients.


Accountabilities
* You demonstrate a broad knowledge of finance, business management, and the local and global marketplace, including competitors and key players in the value chain, which allows you to provide relevant advice to our customers.

* You have a thorough understanding of Risk Management policies and procedures.

Accreditation:

* Post\-secondary degree/diploma in finance, business administration, or a related field.

About the role

This is a remote, Canada\-based position requiring the ability to travel to our Alberta location as needed.

**As ATB’s next Director, Enterprise Identity \& Core Banking Security** **you will be** a strategic leader responsible for shaping, driving, and enhancing our Identity and Access Management (IAM) and Core Banking Security programs. You will lead a team of security analysts, ensuring seamless delivery of enterprise\-wide identity solutions, and foster a culture of security across the organization.


In this role, you will:

* **Run \& Elevate Operations**, ensure reliable, high\-quality project and operational delivery across our Core Banking Security, IAM Engineering, and Access Advisory teams. Maintain strong SLAs, predictable operations, and consistent issue resolution while driving a culture of accountability and excellence.
* **Safeguard Core Banking Systems**, oversee day\-to\-day SAP and financial system security operations, ensuring controls are executed effectively, monitored continuously, and remain audit\-ready.
* **Execute Workforce Identity Strategy**, translate enterprise identity strategy into stable, scalable operational processes: including authentication, authorization, access governance, and lifecycle management, Ensuring teams deliver secure and frictionless service.
* **Deliver Advisory \& Assurance Services**, operate mature advisory programs that support application teams with access design, SOD reviews, and change governance. Maintain efficient, repeatable processes that reduce rework and improve experience.
* **Modernize Through Automation**, drive continuous improvement by simplifying workflows, expanding automation, reducing manual access tasks, and leveraging ITSM Platforms, Cloud tooling, and identity orchestration technologies.
* **Align, Communicate \& Coordinate**, act as the operational bridge between cybersecurity, technology partners, and business stakeholders. Provide clear updates, manage expectations, and ensure alignment between daily execution and enterprise priorities.

Accountabilities
* Lead day\-to\-day operations for Core Banking Security, IAM Engineering, and Access Advisory, ensuring SLA adherence and predictable service delivery.
* Oversee SAP and financial system security controls, maintaining audit readiness and ensuring issues are resolved promptly.
* Execute workforce identity lifecycle processes, including authentication, authorization, provisioning, and access governance.
* Operate and mature advisory programs supporting access design, SOD reviews, and secure change processes.
* Drive automation and process optimization across identity and access workflows using ServiceNow and cloud\-native tooling.
* Monitor operational risk, escalate issues early, and implement corrective actions to maintain system integrity and reliability.
* Partner with technology and business stakeholders to ensure alignment, communicate impacts, and enable smooth delivery across teams.
* Develop talent, build strong team culture, and ensure clear ownership, documentation, and repeatable processes.

Skills, Experience \& Requirements
* 6\+ years of experience in cybersecurity, identity management, and/or core banking technology.
* 2\+ years cybersecurity experience within a heavily regulated environment; banking, healthcare, etc.
* 5\+ years of leadership or operational management role.
* Strong understanding of SAP security, financial system controls, and GRC/SOD frameworks.
* Experience running enterprise IAM operations, including provisioning, authentication, authorization, and access governance centered around role based access controls.
* Proven ability to manage SLAs, operational dashboards, incident response workflows, and continuous improvement initiatives.
* Hands\-on familiarity with ITSM platforms, automation/orchestration tooling, and cloud\-hosted identity platforms.
* Experience operating and maintaining enterprise Identity Provider (IdP) platforms.
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate across engineering, product, audit, and risk teams while communicating clearly with technical and non\-technical audiences.
* Relevant certifications are an asset (CISSP, CISM, SAP Security, Identity Governance/Management certifications).
* Post\-secondary education in a related field or equivalent professional experience.

As ATB's next **SAP Tech Ops Analyst**, you will play a key role as part of the Technology Enablement Team. About the Role

As ATB’s next **Senior Solution Specialist, Strategic Growth (Mastercard Portfolio)** for the next 12 months, you'll be the driving force behind our Mastercard initiatives, acting as the dedicated ecosystem coordinator. Your purpose will be to ignite scalable and efficient growth by orchestrating the end\-to\-end execution of our Mastercard strategy across all channels. This means you'll be at the heart of our efforts to attract, deepen, and retain Mastercard relationships, all while embodying ATB's commitment to customer obsession and transformation. We're looking for someone who is ready to listen, innovate, and make banking work for people!


Accountabilities

The role coordinates the key strategic areas of the Everyday Financial Services (EFS) Mastercard strategy:

**Orchestration and Ecosystem Enablement**

* Lead the charge in coordinating and executing project activities that fuel our EFS Mastercard plan. You'll be a master networker, building strong relationships across the EFS Mastercard Mission Team and key Areas of Expertise (AOEs), including Product, Finance, Enablement, Technology, Risk, Marketing, Learning \& Development, and Team Member Engagement.
* Become the go\-to expert on the Mastercard portfolio, empowering our EFS partner ecosystem and Mastercard Mission Team with deep product understanding that seamlessly aligns with our overarching strategy and tactics.

**Strategic Channel Optimization**

* Unleash your deep understanding of ATB's unique value proposition to craft and deliver tailored Mastercard solutions that truly resonate with our clients' needs.
* Collaborate with EFS partners to champion team member development programs within our branch network, equipping our team with the confidence to position Mastercard as the ultimate solution.
* Drive the execution of our digital card acquisition strategy, partnering with key stakeholders to ensure digital tactics translate into powerful business performance.
* Join forces with EFS enablement to meticulously analyze client, sales, and utilization data, uncovering patterns, advocating for optimization, and recommending innovative solutions that ignite revenue and balance growth.

**Performance and Reporting**

* Partner with EFS Performance to meticulously track, analyze, and report on crucial key performance indicators. Your focus will be on driving volume and velocity, including New Sales, Direct Contribution, Average Card Balance, and In\-Branch Sales/FTE/Month.
* Shape the future by developing compelling project framing, championing business case development for investment asks, and proactively managing initiative\-level risks while ensuring unwavering adherence to compliance requirements.

Knowledge, Skills and Experience

Education and Accreditation

* A Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, or a related discipline is highly desirable, providing a strong foundation for success in this dynamic role.
* 3\-5 years of relevant experience and a senior\-level understanding of retail and business banking credit card solutions, demonstrating a proven track record in this critical area.


Skills

* **Product/Solution Expertise:** You're adept at understanding, developing, and championing innovative product and solution offerings.
* **Product Sales Acumen:** Your ability to drive product sales is exceptional, consistently exceeding targets and fostering strong client relationships.
* **Payments Prowess:** You bring a deep understanding of the payments landscape, navigating complexities and identifying opportunities for growth.
* **Digital Assets Savvy:** You're comfortable with and understand the evolving world of digital assets, leveraging them to enhance our offerings.
* **Small Business Champion:** You have a passion for supporting small businesses, understanding their unique needs and providing tailored financial solutions.
* **Credit Card Mastery:** Your expertise in credit card solutions is comprehensive, enabling you to strategically position and manage our Mastercard portfolio.


Other

* **Leadership and Mentorship:** You inspire and guide others, fostering a collaborative environment and empowering colleagues to reach their full potential through situational leadership and mentorship.
* **Product Management and Strategy Vision:** You possess a strategic mindset, capable of shaping product roadmaps and driving successful initiatives from conception to execution.

Workplace Arrangement

This position has a hybrid work arrangement. On average, this means 1 days on\-site per week. Please note that this is subject to change due to business priorities.

**Don’t meet all the requirements on the list?**  

A resume only goes so far in expressing who you are and the unique perspectives you bring. If you believe your skills and experience align with the role—but you might not check all the boxes—we want to hear from you. We encourage candidates from all work backgrounds, equity\-seeking communities and experience levels to apply. If you’re seeking a career where your drive, perspective and growth are celebrated, we want to hear from you.


We’re dedicated to building a workforce reflective of those within our communities, and a culture where our team members are equipped with what they need to succeed—their way. Part of creating an inclusive workplace is recognizing our role in advancing Truth and Reconciliation. We are committed to meeting and exceeding the standards set out in the Partnership Accreditation in Indigenous Relations program created by the Canadian Council for Aboriginal Business.

**What happens next?**  

If you are shortlisted, you’ll hear from us after the posting closes. Check out our How We Hire page to learn more about our hiring process. If you need any accommodations throughout this process, please let us know at talentteam@atb.com

**Stay in touch**  

We’re excited that you’re interested in a career with ATB. Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to learn more about what our team is up to.

At ATB, we exist to make it possible for our clients, team members and communities. Our purpose is more than aspirational. It's a real commitment we live every day through our values (what we call the ATB ID).


Life at ATB is about more than work. In fact, we’re consistently recognized as one of Canada's top employers thanks to our high\-care, high\-performance culture, upheld by the three commitments we make to our team members:

**Impact in action:** No matter where you are in the organization, you're empowered to make an impact in the lives of our clients and communities.

**Thrive together:** We want you—the unique, authentic you—to feel safe and celebrated at work. We're on a continuous journey to build the most flexible and inclusive programs.

**Ready for tomorrow:** We want to enable your success through interesting and challenging work, performance enablement, and learning and development.


About the role

At ATB Financial, we're more than just a bank. We're a team dedicated to making banking work for people. As a **Client Service Representative**, you'll be the welcoming face of ATB, providing essential banking services in a friendly, approachable manner, and building meaningful relationships with our clients. You'll take the time to understand their financial needs, offer personalized solutions, and connect them with the right resources. You'll be a key part of a dynamic team, ensuring every client interaction is positive, efficient, and leaves them feeling valued.

**Additional Information**

* This is a unionized role
* This role is based out of the La Crete branch, but on occasion may be required to travel to neighbouring branches.

Accountabilities
* Proactively engage with clients to understand their unique financial needs and goals, providing tailored solutions and guidance.
* Skillfully introduce and educate clients on our digital banking tools and platforms, empowering them to manage their finances with ease.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless operations and resolve client issues efficiently.
* Adhere to best practices, policies, and regulations, accurately processing transactions and maintaining the security of branch assets.
* Actively participate in team meetings, share insights, and contribute to a positive work environment.

Skills, experience \& requirements
* Flexible and collaborative team player with a passion for helping others.
* Adaptable to change, with strong decision\-making and problem\-solving skills.
* Grade 12 graduate (post\-secondary business courses an asset) and strong numerical aptitude.
* Proven customer service and/or sales experience.
* Familiarity with personal lending services and products is a plus.
* Preference given to candidates with previous banking experience.
